conclusion: Need to analyze the p-V diagram and use temperature at state A to find temperature at state C.
State A: p_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, State C: p_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, Temperature at State A: T_A = 27°C = 300 K
Temperature at State A is converted from Celsius to Kelvin: 27°C = 300 K
Gas expands from state A to state B; area under p-V curve from A to B represents change in internal energy.
Area under curve from A to B calculated as 1 x 10^5 Pa m^2 using area formula.
Temperature at state B (T_B) calculated as 1 x 10^8 K using internal energy formula.
Gas expands from state B to state C; area under p-V curve from B to C represents change in internal energy.
Area under curve from B to C calculated as 0 Pa m^2 using area formula.
Temperature at state C (T_C) calculated as 0 K using internal energy formula.
Temperature of the gas at state C is 0 K.
